intro: Bunium paucifolium var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed fennel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white flowers arranged in compound umbels. Its seeds are small and ovoid, often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive benefits. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates with distinct seasonal variations.
